member.name: T:Daze.Wav
member.summary: A Wav is exactly what you would expect... a Wav. You can create it from resources using Engine.loadWavFromResources

member.name: P:Daze.Wav.disposeAtEnd
member.summary: Set to true to make the Wav remove from the Engine managed Wavs at the end of the sound

member.name: P:Daze.Wav.volume
member.summary: The volume of this Wav, it goes from 0 to 100

member.name: P:Daze.Wav.loop
member.summary: Set to true to make the Wav restart after it finished playing.

member.name: M:Daze.Wav.Play
member.summary: You don't really need this comment, right? (It start the sound)

member.name: M:Daze.Wav.Pause
member.summary: You don't really need this comment, do you? (It pause the sound)

member.name: M:Daze.Wav.Stop
member.summary: You don't really need this comment, do you? (It stop the sound)

member.name: T:Daze.Collider
member.summary: This class represent a collider

member.name: F:Daze.Collider.gameObject
member.summary: The gameObject of this collider

member.name: M:Daze.Collider.#ctor(Daze.GameObject)
member.summary: The gameObject of this collider

member.name: P:Daze.Collider.ray
member.summary: The maximum distance from the center and a vertex of this collider

member.name: M:Daze.Collider.collide(Daze.Collider)
member.summary: A method to check if a collider is colliding with this one
member.param: The second collider to check
member.returns: True if they collide, false otherwise

member.name: M:Daze.Collider.recreateCollider
member.summary: It forces the collider's coordinates recalculation

member.name: M:Daze.Collider.moveCollider
member.summary: This move the collider, it will be called automatically when his gameObject is moved

member.name: M:Daze.Collider.moveCollider(Daze.GameObject)
member.summary: This move the collider, it will be called automatically when his gameObject is moved

member.name: M:Daze.Collider.rotateCollider
member.summary: It forces the collider's coordinates recalculation after a gameObject rotation

member.name: M:Daze.Collider.rotateCollider(Daze.GameObject)
member.summary: It forces the collider's coordinates recalculation after a gameObject rotation

member.name: M:Daze.Collider.inCollider(Daze.Geometry.Point)
member.summary: This method check if a point is inside the Collider
member.param: The point to check
member.returns: True if the point is inside the Collider, false otherwise

member.name: M:Daze.Collider.inCollider(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: This method check if a point is inside the Collider
member.param: The x coordinate of the point to check
The y coordinate of the point to check
member.returns: True if the point is inside the Collider, false otherwise

member.name: T:Daze.CircleCollider
member.summary: A collider that use a circle as it's shape... wow, so unexpected.

member.name: F:Daze.CircleCollider.circle
member.summary: The circle that's used to perform collision checks

member.name: M:Daze.CircleCollider.#ctor(Daze.GameObject)
member.summary: Create a CircleCollider
member.param: The gameObject that will update the collider coordinates when it's coordinates changes

member.name: P:Daze.CircleCollider.ray
member.summary: The radius of the circle

member.name: M:Daze.CircleCollider.collide(Daze.Collider)
member.summary: Check if this collider collides with another one
member.param: The second collider to check
member.returns: True if they collide, false otherwise

member.name: M:Daze.CircleCollider.recreateCollider
member.summary: This force the coordinates recalculation for this collider

member.name: M:Daze.CircleCollider.moveCollider(Daze.GameObject)
member.summary: This force the coordinates recalculation for this collider when the gameObject is moved

member.name: M:Daze.CircleCollider.rotateCollider(Daze.GameObject)
member.summary: This force the coordinates recalculation for this collider when the gameObject is rotated (since this is a circle rotating it is totally pointless, don't use this please :( )

member.name: M:Daze.CircleCollider.inCollider(Daze.Geometry.Point)
member.summary: This method check if a point is inside the Collider
member.param: The point to check
member.returns: True if the point is inside the Collider, false otherwise

member.name: T:Daze.RectangleCollider
member.summary: A collider with the shape of a rectangle.

member.name: P:Daze.RectangleCollider.ray
member.summary: The distance from the center to a vertex of the rectangle (Pratically it's half of a diagonal)

member.name: M:Daze.RectangleCollider.#ctor(Daze.GameObject)
member.summary: Create a RectangleCollider
member.param: The gameObject that will be used to calculate the rectangle position

member.name: M:Daze.RectangleCollider.moveCollider(Daze.GameObject)
member.summary: This force the recalculation of the coordinates after the gameObject moves
member.param: The gameObject that moved(it should be this collider's gameObject)

member.name: M:Daze.RectangleCollider.recreateCollider
member.summary: This recalculate every coordinate of the collider

member.name: M:Daze.RectangleCollider.collide(Daze.Collider)
member.summary: This function check if a collider is colliding with this one
member.param: The other collider to check
member.returns: Return true when they collide, false otherwise

member.name: T:Daze.ConvexPolygonCollider
member.summary: A general collider that can have different shapes as long as it's shape is convex

member.name: F:Daze.ConvexPolygonCollider.polygon
member.summary: The polygon used to check collisions

member.name: M:Daze.ConvexPolygonCollider.#ctor(Daze.GameObject)
member.summary: Create a ConvexPolygonCollider
member.param: The gameObject that will be used to calculate the polygon position

member.name: M:Daze.ConvexPolygonCollider.collide(Daze.Collider)
member.summary: This check if this collider is colliding with another one
member.param: The second collider to check
member.returns: True if the two collider collide, false otherwise

member.name: M:Daze.ConvexPolygonCollider.rotateCollider(Daze.GameObject)
member.summary: This forces the collider's coordinates recalculation after that the gameObject rotates
member.param: The gameObject that will be used to check rotation and calculate the new coordinates

member.name: M:Daze.ConvexPolygonCollider.moveCollider(Daze.GameObject)
member.summary: This update the collider's coordinates after that the gameObject moves
member.param: The gameobject that will be used to recalculate the coordinates, it should be this collider's gameobject

member.name: M:Daze.ConvexPolygonCollider.inCollider(Daze.Geometry.Point)
member.summary: This method check if a point is inside the Collider
member.param: The point to check
member.returns: True if the point is inside the Collider, false otherwise

member.name: T:Daze.GameForm
member.summary: The form used by the Engine to show the game, you have no need to use this.

member.name: T:Daze.Engine
member.summary: This is the core class of Daze, call Engine.Start() to start your game

member.name: T:Daze.Engine.Utility
member.summary: This is a static class that contains some method that can be used to do various things

member.name: M:Daze.Engine.Utility.RandomInt(System.Int32)
member.summary: This method generate a random int number
member.param: The maximum number generated
member.returns: A number from 0 to max (both included in the range)

member.name: M:Daze.Engine.Utility.countStringOccurrences(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: (Wait... you really need me to explain this... ?) A simple function that count the occurrence of a string in another string
member.param: The large string
The small string that must be searched in the larger one

member.name: P:Daze.Engine.camera
member.summary: This is the camera that is showing on the screen (Daze currently support only one camera)

member.name: F:Daze.Engine.lostFocus
member.summary: You can hook up an action to the engine to know when the game is not active and make it stop

member.name: F:Daze.Engine.gotFocus
member.summary: You can hook up an action to the engine to know when the game is active again and make it resume

member.name: P:Daze.Engine.window
member.summary: This is the window that is showing the game, theorically you shouldn't need it, but if you want to do something particular... go for it ;)

member.name: P:Daze.Engine.cursorHide
member.summary: Setting this to true or false will show of hide the cursor

member.name: F:Daze.Engine.printFpsFlag
member.summary: Setting this flag to true will show the FPS count in the console and the difference between the game cycle and the draw time, you should use it only if you are experiencing heavy FPS drop and you have no idea what's going on

member.name: F:Daze.Engine._deltaTime
member.summary: The milliseconds that the last game cycle took This can be used to do physics calculation regardless of FPS.

member.name: P:Daze.Engine.deltaTime
member.summary: Use this function to make your game frame rate independent, an example: by multiplying 2 in the Update for this you are basically saying 2 per second

member.name: P:Daze.Engine.drawBufferHeight
member.summary: The height of the screen

member.name: P:Daze.Engine.drawBufferWidth
member.summary: The width of the screen

member.name: M:Daze.Engine.Start(System.Int32)
member.summary: This function start the Engine
member.param: The maximum FPS that the Engine should reach, don't specify it if you don't need it

member.name: M:Daze.Engine.Stop
member.summary: This stop the Engine, making your code resume from Engine.Start() Use this to close the game

member.name: M:Daze.Engine.findGameObjects
member.summary: Get all the gameObject currently in the Game
member.returns: An array that contains all the gameObject that are not deleted

member.name: M:Daze.Engine.findGameObjects``1
member.summary: Get all the gameObjects of a given GameObject subClass
member.typeparam: The type of the gameObjects to find

member.name: M:Daze.Engine.gameObjectExists(Daze.GameObject)
member.summary: Check if a GameObject exists currently
member.param: The GameObject to search

member.name: M:Daze.Engine.isGameObjectDestroyed(Daze.GameObject)
member.summary: Check if a GameObject is destroyed
member.param: The GameObject to search
member.returns: true if the gameObject doesn't exists

member.name: M:Daze.Engine.AddGameObject(Daze.GameObject)
member.summary: NOT RECOMMENDED: This method add forcefully a gameObject in the gameObjects list, when a gameObject is created it is automaticaly added to the list, don't use this method if you are not sure what you are doing
member.param: The GameObject to add

member.name: M:Daze.Engine.DeleteGameObject(Daze.GameObject)
member.summary: Delete a gameObject from the gameObject list
member.param: The gameObject to remove

member.name: M:Daze.Engine.loadSprite(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method load a Sprite from a resource. After that you loaded a sprite in this way the next load for the same sprite will not happen and you will just get a reference to the Sprite, so feel free to call it for every GameObject you need, you won't slow down the game due to I/O operations.

members.member:
This method load a Wav from a resource embedded in your project
The name of the resource representing the wav /// True if you want the sound to loop till you pause or stop it The Wav loaded

member.name: M:Daze.Engine.loadWavFromFile(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method load a wav from a file

member.name: M:Daze.Engine.playWavFromResources(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method play a Wav from the resources. Using this method you don't need to manage the Wav initialization and disposition when the sound ends

member.name: M:Daze.Engine.playWavFromFile(System.String)
member.summary: This method play a Wav from a file. Using this method you don't need to manage the Wav initialization and disposition when the sound ends
member.param: The path of the Wav file

member.name: T:Daze.Camera
member.summary: A camera object

member.name: P:Daze.Camera.collider
member.summary: The collider of the Camera. (Except for the fact that the camera can't have a collider :P)

member.name: F:Daze.Camera.isFixed
member.summary: It set the camera to being fixed. A fixed camera cannot move, and the GameObjects can't go out of his limits

member.name: F:Daze.Camera.limits
M:Daze.Camera.setBackGround(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: This set the background of the Camera.

member.name: M:Daze.Camera.move(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: This move the camera
member.param: the x offset of the movement
the y offset of the movement

member.name: T:Daze.Camera.Limits
member.summary: The struct for showing camera's limits, you don't have reason to use this.

member.name: F:Daze.Camera.Limits.minX
member.summary: The coordinate in the world plane of the left limit of the camera

member.name: F:Daze.Camera.Limits.minY
member.summary: The coordinate in the world plane of the upper limit of the camera

member.name: F:Daze.Camera.Limits.maxX
member.summary: The coordinate in the world plane of the right limit of the camera

member.name: F:Daze.Camera.Limits.maxY
member.summary: The coordinate in the world plane of the bottom limit of the camera

member.name: T:Daze.IgnoreLayer
member.summary: This is a layer for ignoring collisions, you can add Types or specific gameObjects to a layer. Adding a layer to a gameObject make that gameObject unable to collide with everything that is inside the layer

member.name: F:Daze.IgnoreLayer.gameObjects
member.summary: The list of gameObjects that should be ignored while checking collisions

member.name: F:Daze.IgnoreLayer.types
member.summary: The list of Types of gameObjects that should be ignored while checking collisions

member.name: M:Daze.IgnoreLayer.#ctor
member.summary: The constructor simply initialize the lists

member.name: T:Daze.Geometry.Utility
member.summary: A static class with some methods that can be useful for creating new collider Types

member.summary: The rotation of this polygon

member.name: F:Daze.Geometry.ConvexPolygon.ray
member.summary: The ray of the polygon is the distance from the center and a vertex

member.name: T:Daze.Sprite
member.summary: A Sprite in daze is a array of bytes representing a Bitmap.

member.name: P:Daze.Sprite.pixelArray
member.summary: The array of pixels that represent this sprite

member.name: P:Daze.Sprite.width
member.summary: The width of the sprite

member.name: P:Daze.Sprite.height
member.summary: The height of the sprite

member.name: P:Daze.Sprite.stride
member.summary: The length of a line of pixel of this sprite measured in bytes

member.name: P:Daze.Sprite.bytesPerPixel
member.summary: How many bytes a pixel takes

member.name: M:Daze.Sprite.#ctor(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: This create a sprite from a Bitmap. In Daze a sprite is nothing more than an array of bytes representing the bitmap so it can be accessed more fastly.
member.param: The original Bitmap

member.name: T:Daze.Timer
member.summary: A timer of a GameObject, gameObject can have several timers, you can edit them by using gameObject.createTimer and so on.

member.name: P:Daze.Timer.ID
member.summary: The ID of the timer

member.name: P:Daze.Timer.msPerTick
member.summary: The number of MS of the duration of this timer

member.name: F:Daze.Timer.currentMS
member.summary: The current milliseconds of this timer

member.name: F:Daze.Timer.tickAction
member.summary: The action that this timer execute every time it reach the msPerTick number of milliseconds

member.name: F:Daze.Timer.restartFlag
member.summary: If this flag is set to true the timer will automatically restart after it ticks, otherwise you will have to start it again manually

member.name: M:Daze.Timer.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Action,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.param: The ID of the timer
The number of MS of the duration of this timer
The action that this timer execute every time it reach the msPerTick number of milliseconds

member.name: M:Daze.Timer.ticked
member.summary: Return true if the time ticked NOTE: this method will also restart the timer if the resetFlag is true

member.name: M:Daze.Timer.restart
member.summary: This method restart the timer.

member.name: M:Daze.Timer.set(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method can be used to set the timer again in one line

member.name: P:Daze.GameObject.spriteSet
member.summary: The SpriteSet for this gameObject

member.name: F:Daze.GameObject.lastPixelPosition
member.summary: The position of the gameObject on the screen in the last Cycle

member.name: F:Daze.GameObject.pixelPosition
member.summary: The position of the gameObject on the screen

member.name: F:Daze.GameObject.position
member.summary: The position of the gameObject

member.name: P:Daze.GameObject.rotation
member.summary: The rotation of the gameObjects

member.name: F:Daze.GameObject.drawLayer
member.summary: The position of the GameObject on the Z axis (note: the Z axis is Only used for drawing's priority)

member.name: P:Daze.GameObject.collider
member.summary: The collider of this GameObject, colliders can have various shapes and they do adapt to the SpriteSet size

member.name: P:Daze.GameObject.lastCollision
member.summary: Returns the object that collided with this Object in the last movement, can be NULL

member.name: F:Daze.GameObject.timers
member.summary: The timers of this gameObject excluding the new created ones NOT RECOMMENDED: You should use the default functions related to timers for editing

member.name: F:Daze.GameObject.newTimers
member.summary: The timers of this gameObject created in this game cycle NOT RECOMMENDED: You should use the default functions related to timers for editing

member.name: F:Daze.GameObject.toDeleteTimers
member.summary: The timers of this gameObject to be deleted at the end of this game cycle NOT RECOMMENDED: You should use the default functions related to timers for editing

member.name: F:Daze.GameObject._lastCollision
member.summary: This contain the GameObject that collided with this one in the last movement (NULL if there was no collision)

member.name: F:Daze.GameObject.ignoreLayers
member.summary: The layers of colliders that this GameObjects should ignore while checking collisions

member.name: F:Daze.GameObject.mouseClick
member.summary: You can add handler here to manage the click on this gameObject

member.name: F:Daze.GameObject.mouseDoubleClick
member.summary: You can add handler here to manage the double click on this gameObject

member.name: F:Daze.GameObject.mouseMove
member.summary: You can add handler here to manage the mouse movement inside this gameObject

member.name: F:Daze.GameObject.mouseDown
member.summary: You can add handler here to manage the mouse down event on this gameObject

member.name: F:Daze.GameObject.mouseUp
member.summary: You can add handler here to manage the mouse up event on this gameObject

member.name: M:Daze.GameObject.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a GameObject
member.param: The position of the GameObject on the X axis
The position of the GameObject on the Y axis
The priority for drawing this Object

member.name: M:Daze.GameObject.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Create a GameObject
member.param: The position of the GameObject on the X axis
The position of the GameObject on the Y axis

member.name: M:Daze.GameObject.getTimer(System.Int32)
member.summary: It retrives a Timer in this GameObject from its ID
member.param: The if of the Timer to search for
member.returns: The searched Timer, can be NULL if there is no Timer with the specified ID

member.name: M:Daze.GameObject.removeTimer(System.Int32)
member.summary: It deletes a Timer in this GameObject from its ID
member.param: The if of the Timer to delete
member.returns: Returns true if the timer was found and deleted, false otherwise

member.name: M:Daze.GameObject.move(Daze.Vectors.Vector)
member.summary: This function moves the gameObject of a certain offset
member.param: The vector representing the movement of the gameObject

member.name: M:Daze.GameObject.move(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: This function moves the gameObject of a certain offset
member.param: The offset of the movement of the GameObject on the X axis
The offset of the movement of the GameObject on the Y axis
member.returns: This return true if the gameObject moved without collisions, false otherwise

member.name: M:Daze.GameObject.checkCollisions
member.summary: Check if this object collides with some other objects.
member.returns: This method return ONLY the first gameObject found that collides, NOT ALL OF THEM.

member.name: M:Daze.GameObject.Update
member.summary: This method is called every game cycle, here you should check your timers, input flags, process movements and so on.

member.name: M:Daze.GameObject.Start
member.summary: This method is called once after the Object is created and before the first Update.

member.name: M:Daze.GameObject.OnCollisionEnter
member.summary: This method is called when this object is colliding with another Object, the collision data are in the lastCollision property

member.name: M:Daze.GameObject.delete
member.summary: Deletes this gameObject, is just a call to the Engine.DeleteGameObject function

member.name: T:Daze.GameScript
member.summary: A GameScript is a script called by the Engine when it starts and then automatically every Game Cycle

member.name: M:Daze.GameScript.Update
member.summary: A method that keep being called continuosly

member.name: M:Daze.GameScript.Start
member.summary: This method is called just once, just after the script initialization

member.name: T:Daze.SpriteSet
member.summary: A spriteSet is a list of sprites with a timer, it can be used to create an animation

member.name: F:Daze.SpriteSet.size
member.summary: The size of an image of this spriteSet

member.name: P:Daze.SpriteSet.minX
member.summary: The starting X of the first coloured pixel, this is used to draw just the coloured part of a sprite and not an alpha part (if present)

member.name: P:Daze.SpriteSet.minY
member.summary: The starting Y of the first coloured pixel, this is used to draw just the coloured part of a sprite and not an alpha part (if present)

member.name: P:Daze.SpriteSet.sprite
member.summary: The sprite currently used from this SpriteSet

member.name: M:Daze.SpriteSet.reset
member.summary: This reset the SpriteSet, making it go back to the first Sprite and restart the Timer for changing images

member.name: P:Daze.SpriteSet.timerID
member.summary: The ID of the timer used by this SpriteSet, SpriteSets always use negative timer IDs.

member.name: P:Daze.SpriteSet.index
member.summary: The index of the spriteSet in the sprites array

member.name: P:Daze.SpriteSet.repeat
member.summary: Set to true to make this SpriteSet cycle Sprites automatically

member.name: P:Daze.SpriteSet.changeMS
member.summary: The number of milliseconds that the SpriteSet will wait before going to the next Sprite

member.name: M:Daze.SpriteSet.#ctor(Daze.GameObject,Daze.Sprite[])
member.summary: This create a SpriteSet, a SpriteSet is a list of sprites, it can be used to create an animation
member.param: The GameObject that this SpriteSet will be attached to
The Sprites that this SpriteSet will have

member.name: M:Daze.SpriteSet.#ctor(Daze.GameObject,System.Action,Daze.Sprite[])
member.summary: This create a SpriteSet, a SpriteSet is a list of sprites, it can be used to create an animation
member.param: The GameObject that this SpriteSet will be attached to
This method will be fired when the SpriteSet finished the Sprite cycle and it's going back to the first Sprite
The Sprites that this SpriteSet will have

member.name: M:Daze.SpriteSet.#ctor(Daze.GameObject,System.Boolean,Daze.Sprite[])
member.summary: This create a SpriteSet, a SpriteSet is a list of sprites, it can be used to create an animation
member.param: The GameObject that this SpriteSet will be attached to
If this flat is set to true the Sprites will change automatically, if you don't set the number of milliseconds for changing the Sprites then the SpriteSet cycle will last 1 second
The Sprites that this SpriteSet will have

member.name: M:Daze.SpriteSet.#ctor(Daze.GameObject,System.Boolean,System.Action,Daze.Sprite[])
member.summary: This create a SpriteSet, a SpriteSet is a list of sprites, it can be used to create an animation
member.param: The GameObject that this SpriteSet will be attached to
If this flat is set to true the Sprites will change automatically, if you don't set the number of milliseconds for changing the Sprites then the SpriteSet cycle will last 1 second
This method will be fired when the SpriteSet finished the Sprite cycle and it's going back to the first Sprite

member.name: M:Daze.SpriteSet.#ctor(Daze.GameObject,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Action,Daze.Sprite[])
member.summary: This create a SpriteSet, a SpriteSet is a list of sprites, it can be used to create an animation
member.param: The GameObject that this SpriteSet will be attached to
The number of milliseconds that the SpriteSet will wait before changing Sprite
If this flat is set to true the Sprites will change automatically, if you don't set the number of milliseconds for changing the Sprites then the SpriteSet cycle will last 1 second
This method will be fired when the SpriteSet finished the Sprite cycle and it's going back to the first Sprite
The Sprites that this SpriteSet will have

member.name: M:Daze.SpriteSet.next
member.summary: This method forcefully change the SpriteSet's Sprite without waiting till the right time to change it This can be helpful in case you want to use the Sprite manually without using the default timer.

member.name: M:Daze.SpriteSet.rotate
member.summary: This method update the rotation of this SpriteSet
